sub_topic: Prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not commutative with respect to intersection.
message_1: There are two sets A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4}. Find the Cartesian product of A and B and then find the intersection of the resulting set with the Cartesian product of B and A. Show that these two sets are not equivalent, and hence, prove that the Cartesian product of two sets is not commutative with respect to intersection.
